topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Build 9 Workarounds

section.title: Workarounds to be followed when hdeploy with Build#9 fails
section.p: If the hdeploy script in build 9 fails, review the topics in this section for troubleshooting.

section.title: Apache2 Failure During hdeploy
section.p: If the hdeploy script fails to restart the Apache v2 web server, the problem can be with the configuration of the Attis role.
You can fix this problem by manually editing the following files, removing a specific file on each controller, and then restarting the hdeploy script with a -t option.

ol.li:
Edit the roles/ATTIS/templates/etc/apache2/sites-available/attis.conf file to replace the following text:
Replace: Listen {{ ATTIS.consumes_KEY_API.vips.admin[0].host }}:9898
with the following: Listen {{ host.vars.my_network_name }}:9898
Replace: <VirtualHost {{ ATTIS.consumes_KEY_API.vips.admin[0].host }}:9898>
with: <VirtualHost {{ host.vars.my_network_name }}:9898>

In the roles/ATTIS/tasks/start.yml file, comment out each of the following lines: # Start Attis service
#- name: Start Attis service # service: name=attis-server state=started
Log onto each of the three (3) controllers in the non-KVM region and remove the rm /etc/apache2/sites-available/attis.conf file.
Execute the hdeploy script on the HLM VM using the -t option: hdeploy –t <cloudname>

section.p: Return to the KVM + ESX installation.

section.title: VRG Failure During hdeploy
section.p: If the DCN installation packages fail to install, do the following:

ol.li:
Comment out following lines from the <clouddir path to ansible>\ansible\roles\DCN-VRG\tasks\install.yml:
#- name: Install packages # apt: name={{ item }} force=yes # with_items: # - qemu-kvm # - libvirt-bin # - libjson-perl # - python-twisted-core # - vlan # - module-init-tools # - uuid-runtime # - libprotobuf-c1 # - python-setproctitle # - nuage-python-openvswitch # - nuage-openvswitch-common # - nuage-openvswitch-switch
Execute the hdeploy script on the HLM VM using the -t option: hdeploy –t <cloudname>

section.p: Return to the KVM + ESX installation.

body.section: nova-compute is down after cloud deploy As a workaround, comment the line log_config_append = /etc/nova/logging.conf in /etc/nova/nova.conf on compute node. Restart nova-compute service on the compute-proxy node and all nova servcies on controllers.

section.title: icinga2 status appears to be in down state on one of the controller node
section.p: Shut down the Icinga2 service on controllers M2 and M3 On Controller M1 do the following:.
Edit the /etc/icinga2/zones.d/<cloudname>-CCP/services/<cloudname>-CCP-T1-services.conf file to remove following blocks:
section.codeblock: apply Service "elk-sch-healthy" { import "generic-service" check_command = "elk-sch-healthy" vars.apply_to_services = [ "ELK-SCH" ] assign where ("BUILD9-CCP-T2" in host.groups || "BUILD9-CCP-T2-VIP" in host.groups) && "ELK-SCH" in host.vars.services } apply Service "elk-kib-healthy" { import "generic-service" check_command = "elk-kib-healthy" vars.apply_to_services = [ "ELK-KIB" ] assign where ("BUILD9-CCP-T2" in host.groups || "BUILD9-CCP-T2-VIP" in host.groups) && "ELK-KIB" in host.vars.services } apply Service "attis-healthy" { import "generic-service" check_command = "attis-healthy" vars.apply_to_services = [ "ATTIS" ] assign where ("BUILD9-CCP-T2" in host.groups || "BUILD9-CCP-T2-VIP" in host.groups) && "ATTIS" in host.vars.services } Restart Icinga2 service ==> service icinga2 restart. Access Icinga-Web http://<CLM-VIP>/icinga-web Credentials: root / password
